modules.description: This module manages variable bindings for HTML templates, supporting string and HTML value substitutions, as well as dynamic functions that generate content based on context. It works with strings, HTML fragments, and functions that take a context object and arguments to produce output. Use it to bind dynamic content like page titles, user-generated HTML, or custom rendering logic for elements such as navigation menus or error displays.

Handles path manipulation and metadata extraction for files in a templating system. It provides operations to navigate directory hierarchies, resolve relative paths, and extract components like filenames, languages, and descriptive names. Useful for generating navigation links and managing multilingual content based on file naming conventions.

This module implements a persistent cache that stores and manages values with dependencies, timeouts, and automatic updates. It works with any marshalable type `'a`, associating each value with a key string and tracking its last update time. Concrete use cases include caching compiled templates or processed HTML fragments that depend on file timestamps or external data sources, ensuring efficient regeneration only when needed.

This module processes HTML templates with variable substitution and static checking. It compiles HTML files into OCaml modules, binds dynamic values to template variables, and generates final HTML output. Key data types include `html` for structured HTML documents and `Binding.t` for variable mappings. Concrete use cases include generating web pages with dynamic content, building reusable email templates, and managing multilingual site layouts with path-based navigation.
